caption: The photograph displays a flag waving under an overcast sky. The flag, attached to a pole on its left side, appears to be partially backlit and silhouetted against the cloudy backdrop, which gives an impression of a slightly dim and moody atmosphere. The flag is emblazoned with the words "WE DIG COAL SAFELY" in bold, black lettering. The design includes an emblem of a crossed pickaxe and a shovel beneath the text, symbolizing mining tools. The composition focuses on the fluttering flag, emphasizing themes of industry and safety in coal mining. The angle of the shot, taken looking up towards the sky, highlights the flag's motion and the elements on it, giving it a sense of pride and prominence.
title: Company flag in front of the headquarters of the Virginia-Pocahontas Coal Company near Richlands, Virginia, in the southwestern part of the state. It is called locally by its Island Creek Coal Company name. V-P is a subsidiary of Island Creek which in turn is a part of the Occidental Petroleum Company.
